51200.name: Dartmoor
51200.description:
"Dartmoor" is an original german scenario for the Cthulhu RPG published by Fantastische Spiele GbR.

From the back of the book (translated):
A horrible murder strikes the city of Exeter. The sunny fall of the year 1920 shouldn't raise such dark thoughts normally. A young lawyer gets the surprising chance to execute the last will of the victim. This simple task leads the investigators to the bounds of their own self. From the mortuary in Exeter it is a long way to the swamp plains of Dartmoor. And isn't that the direful silhouette of Dartmoor Prison reaching out of the mist?

51201.name: Gail 1
51201.description:
"Gail 1" is an original german scenario for the Cthulhu RPG published by Fantastische Spiele GbR and has later received a follow-up, "Gail 2".

From the back of the book (translated):
The desperate notary Clark Peterson hires a private investigator and his frieds to clear up the disappearance of his 18y old ward Mary Gail in wintery London of 1919. Soon they find out that this is not a normal case of kidnapping. A bloody trail leads in a chaotic dance of cosmic horror through the capital of the Empire and into an endlesse bog of madness, blasphemy and murder.

51202.name: Gail 2
51202.description:
"Gail 2" is an original german scenario for the Cthulhu RPG published by Fantastische Spiele GbR and is the follow-up of "Gail 1", supposed so form a small campaign.

From the back of the book (translated):
In charge of the British Museum a party of fearless adventurers travel to Argentina to find two legendary gemstones. This supposedly simple mission appears to become a dangerous task and culminates in meeting a ruthless old villain, who sets out to draw whole mankind into doom. In addition to this, the investigators aren't the only one in search of these gems. Competitors from Germany and the USA are not asleep and do everything to claim the stones for themselves. In the wilderness of Argentina fateful encounters and dramatic races occur. Only one group may become the victor. A horrible fate awaits the losers...

51203.description: A special edition of the game, designed for younger players. The game board shows 6 islands thatvare under attack by the evil black armies. Children must cooperate to avoid the invasion.
51203.name: Risiko! Junior
boardgamefamily: RisiKo!: Risk variations by Spartaco Albertarelli

51204.name: New Eden
51204.description:
"New Eden" is an original german scenario for the Cthulhu RPG published by OMEN Oswald Morden Entertainment and so far this companies only publication.

From the back of the book (translated):
The troubles of the Boer Wars in 1901 lead four investigators into the outbacks of South Africa to New Eden.
Soon they realize that New Eden is not the regular prisoner camp they thought. A strange disease kill the inmates and children disappear.
Terror rules in this camp with all of its facettes.
There's no bounds to the calamity and the party is under heavy tension to fight man's inhumanity with the devil.

51206.name: Alpha Complex Nights 2
51206.description:
From the back cover:

ALPHA COMPLEX NIGHTS 2 - A HARD DAY’S NIGHTCYCLE

Presenting two new missions for your intrepid Troubleshooters!


VIVA LA REVOLUTION!


The unthinkable has happened - The Computer has been overthrown, and everything in Alpha Complex is upside down! Treason is loyalty! Heroes are traitors! (Everyone’s still out to get you, though). The Troubleshooters are given a cushy new assignment as the People’s Glorious Firing Squad, a subcommittee of the People’s Glorious Revolution! They now hold the power of life and death (mostly death) over the Enemies of the People. What will they do with this power? And is The Computer really out for the count? Still, as long as the Troubleshooters are the ones with the guns, everyone will be shouting VIVA LA REVOLUTION!


THE COMMUNIST CAFETERIA CONSPIRACY


Commies! + Mind control lasers! + Nightmarish five-way bureaucratic tangles! = Putting the Troubleshooters in charge of the most prestigious, expensive and fragile cafeteria in the whole sector. Catch the Commies and stop their devilish mind control experiment before the food vats overflow! Deal with cafeteria staff who are traitorous, disobedient, mutated or blatantly French!

51207.name: Spell Law (2nd Edition)
rpgissuearticle: ICE can stand the heat: A long look at Iron Crown's 'Rolemaster' series
51207.description: Back cover summary: Spell Law is now a mighty tome, including over 2000 spell descriptions for three realms of power, covering 15 character classes; detailed alchemy rules; individual spell attack tables, and rules for the use of magic items in a campaign.

51208.name: Arms Law & Claw Law (2nd Edition)
rpgissuearticle: ICE can stand the heat: A long look at Iron Crown's 'Rolemaster' series
51208.description:
Arms Law & Claw Law, 2nd Edition is the core rules weapons system for Iron Crown's original Rolemaster fantasy role-playing system. This second edition book combines the first edition versions of the two earlier works entitled "Arms Law" and "Claw Law".

The Arms Law portion covered weapon attacks while the Claw Law portion covers animal attacks, martial art attacks, and inanimate object attacks such as those from thrown objects or a fall.

The book contained detailed attack charts for 30 weapons and 12 natural weapons and charts and statistics for various critical strikes, fumbles, weapon conversions, maneuvers, animal statistics, armor and shield penalties, and similar text information.

51209.name: Ägypten
51209.description:
"Ägypten" is an original german boxed source book on Egypt for the Cthulhu RPG published by Laurin.

The box contains a rich illustrated book with all one needs to know about the old and 1920s Egypt, information on religion, hieroglyphs and history.

A second book contains three scenarios which confront the players with the ancient culture and the age-old dangers and mysteries of this country along the Nile.

A tourist guide for the players contains everything they need to know about travelling to Egypt: travel, customs conditions, manners and more.

A separate dossier contains playing aids which can be handed out to the players.

Another addition is a large map of the land of the pharaohs.

51210.name: Character Law & Campaign Law (2nd Edition)
51210.description:
Character Law & Campaign Law, 2nd Edition combined Iron Crown's Rolemaster books Character Law and Campaign Law into one book entitled "Character Law & Campaign Law". The Character Law portion of the book is essentially a player's manual without detailed information about magic or weapons while the Campaign Law portion is essentially a gamemaster's guide. The book also includes additional information not included in either of the previous two books.

Topics include character creation, character classes, character races, character skills, price charts, special skills, an enchanted herb list, encounter charts, and various campaign dynamics.

Note: Some printings contained the 1300 product code on the upper right corner of the front cover.

51211.name: Classic Battletech RPG
rpgissuearticle: After Action Report: Raid on Freya
After Action Report: Raid on Freya
Alternate Rules for Building Mechs in Battletech
Alternative Rules for Building Mechs in Battletech
Battle Report: The Battle of Peoria
Chuck's Used BettleMechs Presents: 'Mech Readout #2: CPLT-CK "The Kurita Catapult Variant"
Chuck;s Used BattleMechs Presents: WHM-6M Warhammer
A Continued Look at Light Mechs
How to Kick Goliath Where it Counts
Medium Mechs: The Work Horse of the Inner Sphere
News From The Front: Recounting battles from around the Inner Sphere
Power Armor: The Poor Man's Battlemech
Simulator Tech: Scenario - Blooding On Pandora
So that is what they are...
Tactical Analysis: Light ‘Mechs on the Modern Battlefield (3060+)
The Development of the VHE Shell
The Light Mechs: Tactics and Uses on the Battlefield
Without a Shot: The Art of Manouver
You Know What Drives Me Crazy?
51211.description:
From the back cover

It is the 31st century. Across the vastness of interstellar space, awesome powers vie for supremacy. Amidst this swirl of unending conflict stride BattleMechs, huge robotic weapons of war piloted by elite MechWarriors. Join the action, taking on any one of an endless variety of roles, from spy to smuggler, mercenary to MechWarrior. As a character from the Inner Sphere, the Clans or the Periphery, you will decide the ultimate fate of the galaxy.

Enter the exciting BattleTech universe in this all-new third edition of the MechWarrior roleplaying game. This book contains all the rules and source material players and Gamemasters need. Completely redesigned for faster and easier play, it features a unique character creation system that generates game abilities and background story at the same time.

51212.name: Lostech: The MechWarrior Equipment Guide
51212.description:
From the back of the book:

LOSTECH.

Across the Inner Sphere, the term conjures images of unstoppable weapons, impenetrable armor and other relics of lost technology, advanced equipment forgotten to mankind since the collapse of the Star League some 300 years ago. The awesome power of Lostech - and much, much more - is at your fingertips in this illustrated guide to personal gear in the BattleTech universe.

Lostech: The MechWarrior Equipment Guide includes descriptions and MeachWarrior, Third Edition game rules for more than a hundred new items, featuring a detailed treatment of powered battle armor that includes a full technical readout covering all 20 known models.

51214.name: MechWarrior's Guide to the Clans
51214.description:
From the back cover:

For two centuries, the Clans have genetically bred their warriors. Clansmen are evaluated from birth, with their entire lives revolving around Trials of might-makes-right that whittle away the chaff and create the ultimate soldiers. Dive into this unique warrior culture and battle your way to glory to gain a Bloodname and pass your superior genetic legacy to the next generation.

The MechWarrior's Guide to the Clans is the second volume in the MechWarrior's Guide series for MechWarrior, Third Edition. It provides you with all the material you need to launch your own Clan campaigns. This volume contains seventeen new affiliations, as well as more than a dozen new Life Paths unique to each Clan, complete information for campaigning among the Clans and a full-length adventure.

51215.name: Cthuloide Welten (Issue 1)
51215.description:
Content:

- Bucht der Toten (adventure at germany's east sea coast)
- Masks of Nyarlathotep (essay)
- Was Hänschen nicht lernt ... (article about character development from birth to death)
- Für eine Handvoll Investigatoren (background for Cthulhu "Wild-West")
- Interview with John Tynes from Pagan Publishing
- Die Substanz (Delat Green short-story)
- Katzulhu - Cathulhu (cats as player characters)
- Der Fluch des siebten Mondschattens (floorplans)
- Cthuloide News
- Webtips
- Vernetzte Tentakel (about Cthulhu-websites)
- Tips for gamemastering
- Die Namenlose Seite (humorous)

51216.name: Il toro sul Nilo
51216.description: Second in the Storiagame collection of gamebooks, summer gifts of the "Storia e dossier" monthly magazines. This one is set in ancient Egypt.

51217.name: Nome in codice Assad
51217.description: Third and last of the summer gamebooks given as a gift by the monthly magazine "Storia e Dossier". This time the reader becomes a secret agent in Middle East during WWI, working together with Lawrence of Arabia.

51218.name: Kleine Völker
51218.description:
"Kleine Völker" ("Little People") is a german source and scenario book for the Cthulhu RPG published by Pegasus Spiele.

It contains a short chapter with background informations on Elves and Elbes, Dwarfs and other "little people" from real myth and legend, not how you might now them from fantasy literature.

The main part are two massive scenarios themed around these "little people":

"Siegfriedslust" by Steffen Schütte and Wolfgang Schiemichen has the investigators search for the famous Nibelungenschatz in the 1920s.

"Gestohlene Leben" ("Stolen Lives") by Florian Hardt puts the investigators in a bad weather situation in the Alps, where they have to spent at least one night in a sinister mountain village. King Laurin and his dwarven kind seem to rule this place...

51219.name: Amerika: In Städten und Wäldern
51219.description:
"Amerika - In Städten und Wäldern" ("America - In cities and forests") is a german source book for the Cthulhu RPG published by Pegasus Spiele.

It contains accurate researched historical background information on Amerika in the 1920s. The reader learns about every day's life in the US in cities and on the country side, the Great Depression, Prohibition, police work get's to know new professions and much more.

Later Pegasus published a box set containing this source book and the scenario book "In Labyrinthen". Content of the books didn't change.

In 2009 a completely new North America-themed source book was published, named "USA - Weltmacht unter dem Sternenbanner". It contains mostly new content and is not a re-issue of this book.

51220.name: Deutschland: Blutige Kriege & Goldene Jahre
51220.description:
A german exclusive box from Pegasus Spiele covering
the 1920's life in germany (Weimarer Republik).
More than 50 authors and designers worked on this product,
giving a very detailed historical insight into this era.

51221.name: Saga 11: Rätsel II - weiter geht's (neue Rätsel für Rollenspieler)
51221.description:
"Rätsel für Rollenspieler " ("Riddle for Roleplayers 2") is a small supplement for use with any Fantasy themed RPG.

It contains 44 puzzles (and their solutions) a gamemaster can facilitate in his scenarios and present to his players.

The first volume, Rätsel für Rollenspieler, was originally published in the 1980s and reprinted several times.

From the back of the G&S Verlag edition:

"Rätsel sind ein ganz spezielles Gewürz für den Rollenspielabend: sie sind systemfrei, sie bringen die Spieler zum Nachdenken, sie sind für den Spielleiter willkommene Möglichkeiten, im laufenden Spiel zu improvisieren. Und wenn sie wie bei SAGA, im witzigen Fantasy-Rahmen vorliegen, bringen sie Pepp in mach lahme Runde. Ich habe lange auf einen neuen SAGA-Rätselband gewartet - und der G&S Verlag hat mich nicht enttäuscht! Ein toller SAGA-Band. (Dino König)"

Translation:

"Puzzles are a very special spice to the role-playing evening: they are system-free, they give the gamemaster an opportunity to improvise during the running game. And if they are present the witty fantasy context (as they are here) they add pep to a lame round. I have long been waiting for a new puzzle book from SAGA and the G&S Verlag has not disappointed me. A great SAGA volume. (Dino King) "

51222.name: Soviet Vehicle Guide
51222.description:
From the back cover:

Details and illustrates a plethora of Soviet and Warsaw Pact equipment. many of the vehicles are illustrated in full color. on eight pages of color plates. Also includes worldwide order of battle for all Soviet divisions and several brigades and regiments as of July 2000.

51223.name: Rätsel für Rollenspieler
51223.description:
"Rätsel für Rollenspieler" ("Riddle for Roleplayers") is a small supplement for use with any Fantasy themed RPG published by german Games-In Verlag.

It contains 35 riddles (and their solutions) a gamemaster can facilitate in his scenarios and present to his players.

Games-In published a sequel, Saga 11: Rätsel II - weiter geht's (neue Rätsel für Rollenspieler).

51224.name: Small Arms Guide
51224.description:
From back cover:

Contains a consolidated listing for every personal firearm in the basic game. Each weapon entry contains an illustration of that particular firearm, a few remarks and details for incorporating the weapon into the game.

Includes increased coverage of military and civilian rifles as well as expanded coverage of ammunition types.

Has special essays on reproduction black-powder firearms and the special low-tech auto-rifle, the M16EZ

Finally, it has a consolidated price and equipment listing for all weapons and ammunition types covered in Twilight: 2000.

51225.name: King's Ransom
51225.description:
From introduction:

Provides information to set a campaign in central Iran. Main adventure involves a search for the Crown Jewels of Iran.

Includes descriptions of towns, regions, villages, forces, and encounters. Also has plans for a signal company compound, a cathedral, and a hotel that may figure in the main adventure.

51226.name: Perry Rhodan: Das SF-Rollenspiel
51226.description:
This is the core rules box for the Perry Rhodan RPG by Agema-Verlag published in 1993.

The box contains the core rulebook with everything necessary to create characters in the Rhodan-universe, equipment, attribute, abilities, character development and how to play.

Also included are a scenario called "Auftraggeber: Solare Abwehr" ("Client: Solar Counterintelligence"), a source book "Das Solare Imperium" ("The Solar Empire"), floorplans for the scenario, counters, dice and character sheets.

51227.name: RDF Sourcebook
51227.description:
From back cover:

Provides the setting and backdrop for adventures in the Persian Gulf region.

Includes:

Map of southern Iran

Character generation tables for Americans (USMC, USN, and USAF), British, Iranians, Iraqis, and others

Order of battler for forces remaining in the region

Short descriptions of major personalities and organizations in the region

A mission resolution system allowing a reeree to generate a variety of missions.

51243.name: Blitzkrieg
51243.description:
From the Back Cover:

Amidst a vile axis cloud which threatens to suffocate the free world with its contemptible stench flies a group of partriots dedicated to the perseverance of democracy.

Enlisted on a top-secret assignment by Winston Churchill, the valiant Blackhawk Squadron, the allies' greatest force against the oppressive axis scourge, must infiltrate a hidden Nazi outpost and defend allied leaders from a deadly military assault.

Against a darkening WWII backdrop, the fates of Roosevelt, Churchill, Stalin, deGaulle, and the security if all allied nations rest in the hands of these seven courageous men. Deep behind enemy lines, the Blackhawk Squadron faces its most challenging mission as the Nazi war machine struggles to achieve world conquest.

51244.name: Strangers in Paradise
51244.description:
From the Back Cover:

From high above serene Themyscira, you watch cool, silver moonlight glint off the Island's crystalline harbor waters. Night animals quietly chatter to each other while the rest of Paradise Island sleeps. Then out of the stillness...

Danger threatens the first cultural conference between Amazons and representatives from Man's World. In the serene isolated lands of of Themyscira, discord burns fiercely, seeking to rekindle the sparks of prejudice and force the people of Earth to ever remain Strangers in Paradise.

51246.name: Pantheons of the Megaverse
51246.description:
Rifts Conversion Book Two

Back Cover:

You may think you know all about Zeus, Odin, and Gilgamesh and the other gods of myth and legend, but you'd be wrong!

Mythological gods done Rifts style! Dimension spanning beings of inhuman nature and power, impostors, cyborgs, bio-wizards, the Atlas robot, the Gilgamesh clones, The Olympian Club, alien intelligences, interdimensional mercenaries, vampires, devouring monsters, gods of light, gods of darkness, demigods and supernatural fiends - all with a distinctly Rifts flavor.

Highlights Include:

- Over 150 Gods/Godlings/Demigods and God Pretenders.
- Over a dozen new optional player character R.C.C.s.
- The Godling and Demigod as optional player characters.
- The Rifts Priest O.C.C., skills, prayers, and powers.
- New rune weapons, magic, and the powers of the gods.
- Tips for playing gods and demigods.
- New insight into the Megaverse.
- Countless story ideas.

A supplement for the Rifts rpg. Compatible with Heroes Unlimited, The Palladium Role-Playing Game and the entire Palladium Books Megaverse!

51247.name: The Magic Box
51247.description:
Magic and powers supplement for Buffy the Vampire Slayer rpg.

Back Cover:
So you're not the one and only Slayer...whatever.

With ancient and powerful magics on your side, you don't need to be able to bench press a car to fight evil with the best of them. Whether you're a witch, a warlock, a psychic, a dabbler in the dark arts, or even a superscientist, you have powers granted to few mortals. 'Course there's a potential downside...but bad stuff never happens to the good guys. Right?

Here you'll find all the info you need to master your powers and learn how to introduce the monsters to a world of magical hurt. Oh, and there's also some talk of the dark side...just in case...

The Magic Box is a supplement for the Buffy the Vampire Slayer roleplaying game. In it, you will find:

Speculations on the history of magic and the supernatural in the Buffyverse.
Detailed look at various magical organizations.
New character creation ideas, Qualities and Drawbacks, and more character archetypes for witches, warlocks, psychics, and other users of arcane arts.
Descriptions and stats for rituals and items of mystical power, both those from the BtVS TV show and a few never seen before.
Expanded rules for creating new spells and mystical devices.
Details on psychic powers and other paranormal abilities.
A complete Episode featuring a monster that only powerful magic can vanquish.

51248.name: Black Death
51248.description:
An extended adventure for Ars Magica, second edition.

Back Cover:
Death comes to us in many horrible forms. We may fall to mischievous Demons. We may be struck down by the unseen murdered. Or, we may be taken by the most virulent elemental flame. But all these deaths know no kinship to that most feared by all- the Plague. The Black Death is the most heinous of ends for it leaves one utterly alone. No one can bear the presence of one stricken, and all run in fear. Even the Lord's most faithful servants dare not approach, ensuring that the plague bearer passes without redemption or final forgiveness. Pity he who suffers the Unholy Death.

Black Death is an Ars Magica adventure that pits the characters against a most fearsome foe, the Plague. The town of Montrouge has fallen victim to contagion, and the neighboring Covenant, As Vis Per Veritas, has fallen with it. If the characters hope to salvage Ad Vis Per Veritas, reunite its scattered magi and preserve its rich source of vis, the characters much risk the Plague itself.

Though the may resist the Black Death and rebuild Montrouge, the characters soon learn that a more diabolical power is at work, that the plague may have had origins within the Order of Hermes itself...

51249.name: Bestia
51249.description:
Bestia (The Beast) appeared in one of the issues of Joker - short magazine for gamers published in late 80's in Poland.

The mechanics of Bestia resemble popular Battleships in it's basic, being a paper and pencil guessing game played on sets of the same diagrams but that's where the similarities end.

In Bestia one of the player assumes the role of the Beast - the master of a group of mosters lurking in the depths of a dark dungeon.

The other player (or players) lead a small band of adventurers who seek to destroy the monsters and escape the dungeons with their treasures.

Before the actual game all players secretly deploy they units (the mosters and treasure hoards/adventurers). Players in turns try to find and destroy monsters/adventurers, throwing spells and using weapons.

51250.description:
A small game designed by Susumu Kawasaki.

A game for two players, Gauss: The Magnetic Duel is played on a small hexagonal grid.

Each player has a set fifteen tokens: ten in their color and five in the opposite color. Player take turns and each player may place one token per turn.

Like the poles of a magnet, tokens of opposite color are attracted to each other whereas tokens of like color are repelled by each other.

You score points if you connect 4 or more discs of your colour.
51250.name: Gauss

51251.name: Terra Cthulhiana
51251.description:
German supplement from Pegasus Spiele about strange places
all around the world.
About 30 places are described in detail.

For example:

- Publos of Anasazi
- old Maya-Temples
- Stoen-Age buildings on Malta,
- under-water-ruins near Japan
- Tunguska-Area
- Ruins of Zimbabwe
- Angkor Wat
- Easter-Island
- R'yleh
- Plateau of Leng
- Innsmouth
- Kaddath.

51252.name: Recycling Bingo Game
51252.description: Separate the paper from the plastic and the food from the metal as you sort the trash and try to be the first player to cover all the rubbish on your card. This fun game helps kids learn about the environment and the importance of recycling waste.

51253.name: Weapons
51253.description:
From the front cover:
"an illustrated compendium of arms suitable for use in medieval fantasy role-playing games."

Contents:
Introduction, Swords, Knives, Hafted, Spears, Pole Arms, Miscellaneous, Index, Bibliography

The following information is given for each weapon:
Name, Length (in meters), Mass (in kilograms), Attack Types (cut, chop, thrust, impact), picture. Damage, Symmetry (how well it could be thrown), Parry, and Dex (speed of the weapon) are also given, rated from 1-4.

$4.00

51254.name: 1990's Handbook
51254.description:
Subtitle: Modern Background for Call of Cthulhu

Back Cover:
Call of Cthulhu--Mythos Edition

The horrors lurking in the modern world are often a synthesis of the mundane and the monstrous. For example, the concept of a snuff film is monstrous, but with such a strong foundation of mundane movies full of graphic sex and violence, we can easily believe in their existence even if we have not seen them ourselves. Susan Smith was to all appearances a loving mother, yet she sent the car with her two young sons in it into a lake and let them drown. If these are part of our world, what other, less understandable, horrors must be waiting for us?

The ideas presented in this book attempt to be both mundane and fantastic at the same time- plausibility is the key. It is in the details that the fantastic can rise and stand.

This, then, is a book of details, most mundane and some fantastic. They have but one purpose- that of bringing Lovecraft's horror home to us here and now. The 1990's Handbook is a revision of Cthulhu Now, and brings Call of Cthulhu into the mid-1990's. New equipment detailed includes surveillance paraphernalia, computers, and lethal and non-lethal weapons. The roles of the government, the military, the police, and crime in the modern world are discussed. An optional hit location system is presented. Several scenario storylines are given.

51255.name: Slayer's Handbook
51255.description:
Handbook for Slayer's for the Buffy the Vampire Slayer rpg.

Back Cover:
Just found out you're the Slayer, and feeling a bit overwhelmed? Never fear, it's all right here in Technicolor goodness: the dos, the don'ts, the whys, the wherefores, even a few what's whats. There's also some notes from the Slayers' diaries, just in case you don't hail from Sunnydale.

Study up-it's your neck on the line (literally)!

The Slayer's Handbook is a supplement for the Buffy the Vampire Slayer roleplaying game. In it, you will find:


Background on being a Slayer, tales of the Slayers and advice for Directors on using Slayers in their games
New character creation ideas, qualities and drawbacks, and more character archetypes
Guidelines for alternative settings in a Slayer-oriented game, including different places, times and histories
Three ready-to-play mini-settings for Slayers of all shapes and sizes
A complete Episode continuing the plotline begun in the BTVS corebook

51256.name: ZauberZeit (Issue 20 - Dec 1989)
51256.description:
From the table of contents:

- ZauberZeit Preis 1989 - Die Gewinner! (Winners of 1989 award)
- N&N (News)
- Die fantastischen Filme 1990 (upcoming fantastic genre movies for 1990)
- Fantastisches Buch - fantastischer Film? (Movies after books)
- Wien Wien nur du allein (book tipps for Vienna)
- LeseZeit (book reviews)
- ZauberZeit-Index 1989 (index for the 1989 issues)
- Leserbriefe (editorial)
- In den Minen von Murl (universal location for Middleearth)
- Kannenkunst und Eisenarbeit (essay on medieaval mining)
- Nicht nur um Mitternacht (essay on typical monsters of the night)
- SpielZeitSpezial (essay about Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles games)
- SpielZeit (reviews of numerous board and roleplaying games)
- Kriegfried & Lavendell (Fantasy comic by Serpé)
- Dschungel (reader advertisements; buy, sell, looking for players etc)

51257.name: Buffy Character Journal
51257.description:
Character Sheets for the Buffy the Vampire Slayer rpg.

Back Cover:
Torn-out pages, three-hole punches, worn spots from too much erasing, cramped margin scrawl. That's all so . . . last season. Get with the program and make your evil-eradicating existence that much easier with the Buffy the Vampire Slayer Character Journal. Beautify your stuff, keep everything nicely organized, and watch the Queen of Mean go green with jealousy. Record your character stats, skills, maneuvers, Qualities, Drawbacks, description, history, magic, items, contacts, friends, bragging rights, memorable quotes and much more in this must-have gaming accessory. So drop the paper shuffling and gear up the do-gooding!

51258.name: Director's Screen
51258.description:
Gaming screen and module for Buffy the Vampire Slayer rpg.

Back Cover:
Do you have a plan? If you're a Director and your Buffy the Vampire Slayer roleplayers are looking to you for adventure, you'd better! You don't want things to get ugly, do ya?

No worries though, we've got your plan right here, all wrapped up in one killer package. Yep, everything you Director types need to run a high intensity, large-living and sweet Buffy the Vampire Slayer roleplaying game session (or sessions-hey, there's a whole lotta stuff packed in this bodacious bundle).

A must-have reference for the Buffy the Vampire Slayer Roleplaying Game, the Director's Screen includes:


A full-color, four-panel screen covered with Buffy images and designs to rock the players
Easily referenced charts and tables on the flip side of the screen, freeing you up to focus on the scintillating storyline
A solid section laying out game-running and session-mastering tips to simplify your job and make the players look for more where that came from
Three ready-to-run, interrelated Episodes for the BtVS RPG corebook Archetypes, the Original Cast or your players' own character creations

51259.name: Sea-Steeds and Wave Riders
51259.description: Rules to add accurate seafaring movement to your fantasy RPG campaign. Includes 40 detailed ship plans in 25mm scale.

51260.name: The Nightmare Maze of Jigresh
rpgissuearticle: A Few Great Modules to Play
51260.description: Players race against time to navigate the maze and recover a holy relic while being harried by fiendish monsters.

51261.name: Ready Ref Sheets
51261.description:
The Ready Ref Sheets Package combines the reference sheets published in the Judges Guild's Initial Subscription package and the first three installments (J, K & L): Men Attacking I-8 (5 sheets, double sided with I-6), Monster Attacking I-7 (2 sheets), Chainmail/Man to Man Melee I-6 (5 sheets, double sided with I-8), Encounters / Phantasmal forces J-5 (2 sheets), Construction Costs (2 sheets, double sided with Wizard's Guide), Wizard’s Guide (2 sheets, double sided with Construction Costs), and Character Checklist (2 sheets).

A second edition, entitled Volume I, is in book form and contains additional reference charts and tables compiled from data supplied in the first six Judges Guild installments of the Guildmember subscription. Includes tables for character social levels, street encounters in the City State, poison types, metal and gem types, civilization and technological levels, non-player character cutups, combat tables, construction and research guides, movement obstacles and wilderness terrain, beggars, shock recovery, crime and punishment, guards and garrison troops, resurrection results, special encounters, and more.

51262.name: Trivial Pursuit Edición Familia
51262.description: An edition of Trivial pursuit that is Age 8 and up. The game has 4.800 questions.

51263.name: The Klingons (2nd Edition)
rpg: Star Trek: The Role Playing Game (FASA)
51263.description:
It is an ancient Klingon belief -- the naked stars remember acts of courage performed under them. Find out why in The Klingons.

A must for players and gamemasters alike, this updated and expanded supplement contains two books. The Game Operations manual presents the truth about the Klingon Empire for gamemaster and Klingon player characters. Included are character generation rules, equipment guidelines, the Empire's political and economic structure, Klingon philosophy, and much, much more.

The second book, the Star Fleet Intelligence Manual includes all the information that Star Fleet knows about the Klingon Empire. Compiled from intelligence agent reports, interrogation, and analysis of captured Klingon equipment, this manual is Star Fleet Intelligence Command's latest briefing on the Federation's most dangerous foe.

51264.name: The World of Juravia Sourcebook: Volume 1
51264.description:
From the inside cover:
"Provides information on five Juravian empires: Daryna, Hampton, Hamsburg, Pereysha, and Ry-Gel. This tome provides data on each region's history, government, economy, culture, and more. The book also contains 26 small scendarios (Dungeon Architect section), a mini-adventure (Amnesia), and regional gossip (Rumor section)."

From the back cover:
"Welcome to the World of Juravia... a paradise lost! Once a land graced with beauty, it is now a scarred wasteland of desolate swamps, jagged mountains, and hideous creatures beyond imagining. Nothing of paradise survived the Banishment. Not even the gods. Yet, heroes have begun to emerge from the ruins, wielding magic and steel to challenge the monstrous inheritors. Lives are lost, and courage is put to the test! Come join these heroes! Only your bravery, your skills and your cunning will determine the final outcome. That is if you are brave enough to open The World of Juravia!"

51266.name: NATO vehicle Guide
51266.description:
From back cover:

More than 30 vehicles are detailed and described in game terms, including ones from West Germany, the UK, Canada, and other NATO countries. It has eight pages of full color paintings as well as black and white line drawings.

Also contains organizational data for armies of Denmark, Norway, The Netherlands, the UK, West Germany, and Turkey as well as orders of battle for these nations as of 1 July 2000.

51267.name: The Apokolips Sourcebook
51267.description:
From the Back Cover:

Lost Your Thirst for Sunshine? Come to Apokolips where vacation nightmares begin!

Come visit scenic Apokolips, the home world of Darkseid the Destroyer. Feel free to explore this dark, deserted planet on your own. Or if chance provides, you may receive a guided tour from the Dark Lord or one of his minions, complete with, a close-up view of the Tower of Rage and Granny Goodness Happiness Home.

Once you sift your way through the ashes and debris, you'll discover there's a lot more to this planet than meets the eye. Bask in the heat of the Fire-pits, factories, and mines; frolic among the equipment in the power refineries, installations, and orphanages; or voyage through the slum areas and tunnels of the underground.

If you're a people person, hobnob with the locals, the Hunger Dogs, and learn what life on Apokolips is really like. Or, if you're looking for some real excitement, put yourself in the path of some Para-Demons, War Dogs, or Dog Soldiers. But don't forget your running shoes!

Apokolips has something for everyone, and the price is right -- Nothing ... or maybe your life!

51268.name: Survivors' Guide to the United Kingdom
rpgissuearticle: Survivors’ Guide to the United Kingdom
51268.description:
From the back cover:

This guide describes what happened to the United Kingdom during the war and after. Contains a detailed order of battle for the British army, bringing the OB up to January 1, 2001. Includes British oriented character generation tables and a consolidated reference for British military equipment.

Includes a district by district description of what was nuked, what was destroyed by rioters and othe damage inflicted by the war.

51269.name: Forge: Referee Screen
51269.description:
Four fold stiff paperboard referee screen.

From publisher's website:
"A 34" x 11" (86cm x 28cm) quad-fold Referee Screen with a full color depiction of the Great Wars of Juravia. The Screen provides useful charts, tables, and hints for the Referee and breathtaking artwork for the Players to enjoy. A valuable asset for any Forge gamer!"

51270.name: Monster Smackdown
51270.description:
Adversary and enemies sourcebook for the Buffy the Vampire Slayer rpg.

Back Cover:
Birds gotta fly, fish gotta swim, and a Slayer's gotta have something to slay. Fortunately for her, there's no shortage of vamps, demons, nasties, and Big Bads wandering around out there. And when the latte hits the fan, knowing an Acathla from a Gorch can save the world. The keys to combating these charmless creatures of nightmare are all here, in vivid detail.

"Buffy: To make you a vampire, they have to suck your blood and then you have to suck their blood; it's like a whole big sucking thing.
-1.1 Welcome to the Hellmouth"

Hey, nobody said living on the Hellmouth was going to be all sunshine and stylish garb

The Monster Smackdown is a supplement for the Buffy the Vampire Slayer roleplaying game. In it, you will find:


An overview covering the nature of the Buffyverse, hellmouths, and hell dimensions, including some never before seen samples
A complete rundown on vampires, including their powers, vulnerabilities, morality, nature, and hangouts
A similar treatment for demons, with specific on many demonic races
Details on non-vamp undead, primals, human villains, and various other critters that populate the Buffyverse
Background and specifics on Buffy's major villains, unique demons, hellgoddesses, and real bad nasties, including a revisit of all the seasonal Big Bads
Rules, guidelines, and ideas for creating monsters true to the spirit of the Buffyverse, including a list of mix-and-match monster powers
A complete Episode featuring a major turning point in the Djinn Season

51271.name: Cthuloide Welten (Issue 2)
51271.description:
Content:

- Die Goldenen Hände Suc`naaths (1920's scenario in Berlin)
- Article about Stonehenge
- Heidelberg (information about the famous university city)
- Article about police, law and gun possesion in the 1920's
- Aus den dunklen Zwischenreichen (essay about Nyarlathotep)
- Für ein paar Investigatoren mehr (background & scenario for Cthulhu Wild-West)
- Katzulhu (more cat-races for Cathulhu)
- Interview with author Steffen Schütte
- R.W. Chambers und der König in Gelb (article about the author and the King in Yellow)
- more (webtips, humour, news)

51272.name: Toxic Memes
51272.description:
Memetic sourcebook for Transhuman Space.

Back Cover:
Believe It Or Not . . .

Although you might not have a choice. In 2100, memetics rules- the science of analyzing, engineering, and manipulating ideas. Memeticists know how to get into your head, and will do so for power, money, and religion.

Sometimes they'll do it just for the fun of it.

Transhuman Space: Toxic Memes explores cults, conspiracies, urban legends, fads, and more from around the world at the end of the 21st century. In a world where belief, fear, and ideology can be sculpted like clay, how does anyone know what they really think?

Toxic Memes is a sourcebook for the Transhuman Space setting, and includes detailed rules for the creation and propagation of memes, technologies for controlling information and managing reputations, new characters, new templates, campaign ideas, and over a hundred cults, movements, conspiracies, myths, and fringe sub-cultures to use as adventure seeds, background flavor, and to enhance your game's sense that the world of Transhuman Space is a very strange place indeed.

51273.name: Trader Captains and Merchant Princes (2nd Edition)
rpg: Star Trek: The Role Playing Game (FASA)
51273.description:
From the introduction:

"Designed for use with STAR TREK: The Role Playing Game, this supplement allows gamemasters to add a whole new dimension to their campaigns. With it, players may enter the worlds of high finance in the STAR TREK universe and may replace the Star Fleet ethic with the freewheeling life of the independent trader.

Included are rules for judging the player characters' actions as they buy private ships, obtain cargos, and turn a profit. The economic system of the UFP is defined for player and gamemaster alike, including details on the UFP Stock Exchange, price lists for useful goods and equipment, and much more."

51274.name: Broken Dreams
51274.description:
Setting and politics sourcebook for Transhuman Space rpg.

Back Cover:
Stay and Fight...

On Earth in 2100, some are reaching for the stars...but others struggle just to survive. Much of the home world remains mired in war and intrigue, as powerful corporations and high-tech armies fight over resources, markets, and ideas. Cities on the edge of chaos are battlegrounds for covert operations and high-stakes diplomacy, and the developing nations see themselves falling farther and farther behind.

Nations trapped in poverty, environmental disaster areas, and hellholes run by insane dictators...high-tech terrorism, rebellion, and crime, and rules for creating biological and chemical weapons...dangerous genetic designs, obsolete cybertechnology, and police state software...all part of daily life in Broken Dreams.

51276.name: The CrossRoads of Eternity RPG Core Rule Book
51276.description:
From the back cover:

"In the beginning, the world was savage, and all factions waged war with one another. There was one God of all who created two lesser Gods, one of good, one of evil. A man's only hope of salvation was complete devotion to his God."

Detailed character generation results in highly individual characters. There is a good range of skills, and rules for creating more.

Core rule book contains Bestiary, Races, and a Game Master section, along with the usual Character Creation, Equipment and Magic sections.

51277.name: Todesangst
51277.description:
German adventures for Cthulhu Now from Pegasus Spiele.

Contains 2 scenarios:

Based on the adventure "Love’s Lonely Children" from Richard Watts:
Die Geschichte der Kati S. (The Story of Kati S.)
The players are members of a homicide division in Berlin germany to solve the murder of a young woman.

Kinderstimmen (Children Voices)
A young girl hang herself with a rope. The players have to figure out dark secrets in the bourgeois suburbs.

51278.name: Dark Dungeons
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
51278.description:
User Summary:

Dark Dungeons is an anti-RPG tract from Chick Publications. The tract features the suicide of a player when a sadistic GM kills her character, and a GM who wants to introduce another player to "real" magic. Dark Dungeons is actually enjoyed by most roleplayers who read it, due to its complete lack of any knowledge about roleplaying culture.

Originally published in small pamphlet format, it is now available for free on the web.

51279.name: Adventures in Jimland
51279.description:
Where anything can happen.

Standalone adventure game of strategy, about exploration and discovery in an unknown land. The game resembles somewhat the venerable Source of the Nile inasmuch as the player makes discoveries (plants, animal life, mapping uncharted territory) and must return back to civilization to cash in.

Game requires some means of marking terrain, Also, each player will require one D10, a D6 and a D3 (extrapolated from a D6). A blank map and an expedition roster are provided and those may be reproduced.

51280.description:
Naval Battles off South America, 1914

Simple naval wargame that enables players to recreate the naval battles that were fought off the coast of South America in late 1914. The game consists of rules, game tables, and various historical warship counters and markers. It uses the Salvo! game system, adapted for WWI play.
51280.name: Coronel & Falklands: Naval Battles off South America, 1914

51281.description:
Abstract solitaire game covering the events of March 1936 when Germany reoccupied the Rhineland with military units in contravention of existing treaties, and the response of France, and the world, to this.

The game comes with a small map, 21 counters, and rules. You must also have several six-sided dice, paper and pencil.
51281.name: Occupation of the Rhineland: German Remilitarization, 1936

51282.name: Gen Con IX Dungeon
51282.description:
From the publisher:

The official D&D tournament dungeon for GenCon IX (1976), this booklet contains maps, room keys, hit sheets and time record sheets for two separate mini-dungeons, the two rounds of the contest. Five pre-rolled characters are also provided. The adventure takes place in a world roughly similar to that of the Celtic mythos. An ancient wizard of indeterminable age and skill sends the adventurers to Baldemar Castle, to win the Staff of Albalon.

51283.description:
Solitaire game based on the American seizure of the intact bridge over the Rhine, and its aftermath. Each turn of the game represents two days of real time, beginning on March 7 1945 as elements of the US 9th Armored Division forced its way across a damaged, but still standing, Ludendorff Bridge spanning the Rhine.

The game comes with a small map, 63 counters, and rules. Although the rules do not explicitly say so, it appears the game requires two six-sided dice.
51283.name: Remagen Bridgehead: Americans over the Rhine 1945

51284.name: Fifth Wave
51284.description:
Setting sourcebook for Transhuman Space rpg.

Back Cover:
The Third Wave was information. The Fourth Wave was biotech. The Fifth Wave is a combination of nanotechnology, memetics, and artificial intelligence, and it's changing mankind more than the first four waves put together.

Transhuman Space: Fifth Wave is an overview of our home planet at the end of the 21st century. Most humans (and other sapient life) still live on Earth, doing business, raising families, and fighting wars just as they have always done. Humanity and its partners may be scattering into deep space, but Earth is still the center of the human universe...crowded, busy, fast-moving, and still picking up speed.

Fifth Wave includes new racial packages, plus rules for cutting-edge technology: virtuality nodes, software for network intrusion and defense, and various land, sea and air vehicles of interest to adventurers.

Welcome home. It's different here.

51285.name: Global Pursuit: Set Two
51285.description: This is a set of extra trivia cards for National Geographic's game Global Pursuit. Consists of 6 new decks (People and places, Planet Earth, Historic Happenings, People and Products, and 2 Wild Card decks).

51286.name: Murder at the Vulgar Unicorn
51286.description:
Adventure module set in Thieves World.

Back Cover:
The Wrong Place at the Wrong Time...

Sanctuary. Thieves' World. The grittiest city in fantasy is now yours to explore. For as long as the city has stood, it has weathered divine wars, plague, famine, fires, an invasion, cults, and worse--but are there heroes left to fight against the newest plot to destroy this infamous city?

A sudden and seemingly random murder in the Vulgar Unicorn puts the heroes' freedom in jeopardy. To clear their names, they have to get to the bottom of a terrifying plot to infect the city with a vicious plague. From the outset, the action keeps coming, taking the heroes from the Maze to the Swamp of Night's Secrets, and embroiling them in a vicious plot involving Dyareelan cultists, diseased swine, assassins, and more!

Murder at the Vulgar Unicorn includes:


A complex mystery chock full of action and adventure.
New monsters including the Bengil Crab and the Fenniath.
Six player handouts.
Five pre-generated characters so you can get started right away!
Stats for typically encountered NPCs like Beggars, Guards, Merchants, and more.
13 side adventures and encounters to enhance play.
A detailed map and room description of the Vulgar Unicorn: fantasy's seediest tavern!


Set in the Irrune Era, this adventure provides suggestions for adapting it to the Sanctuary of the classic series. Murder at the Vulgar Unicorn accommodates parties of four to six characters, and while suggested for 1st-level heroes, it can be used with modification for parties of any level. Useable as the start of a new campaign or as a stand-alone adventure, this adventure sets the tone for the Thieves' World campaign setting.

The World of Sanctuary Awaits You!

Requires the use of the Dungeons & Dragons®, Third Edition Core Books, by Wizards of the Coast, for use. The product uses material from the v3.5 revision. Though not required, a copy of Green Ronin's Thieves' World Player's Manual allows you to make the most of this exciting adventure.

51287.name: Thieves' World Gazetteer
51287.description:
Publisher's Blurb:
Azehur, Firaqa, the Rankan Empire, the Kingdom of Ilsig, and more have resonated in the stories and deeds of the famous heroes and villains of Sanctuary. The Thieves' World Gazetteer presents all new information on the world of Sanctuary, expanding the focus to reveal the peoples and places in the Known World. From the Cold Lands in the northeast to the Gate of the East, Mrsevada, the Thieves' World Gazetteer is packed full of information. In addition, this volume includes extensive details on the gods of Thieves' World, a comprehensive history, and a discussion on the cosmology and planes, along with a slew of new cultures, backgrounds, and other supplementary information. With the Thieves' World Gazetteer, Sanctuary is just the beginning of a larger world of adventure!

51288.name: Werewolf Storytellers Companion
51288.description:
"Werewolf Storytellers Companion" is a sourcebook full of information - for the storyteller. This is an important fact, because it includes many facts and backgroundinformation unknown to most of the Garou and can be greatly used to flesh out your Stories.

You will find in here:
- Information about the Stargazers, the "runaway" Tribe
- Fera, the other Werecreatures
- Caerns and the Life in a Sept
- other Inhabitants of the WoD: Vampires, Hunter, Mages, Fearies and Ghosts
- a large Renown Table
- "Merits" and "Flaws"

51289.name: Tunnels & Trolls (7.5 Edition)
51289.description:
From the Back Cover:

This box is packed to the brim with Tunnels & Trolls Goodness. Featuring a revised core rulebook containing additional equipment, examples and a treasure generator. Both a Solo and a GM-based adventure provide out-of-the-box action. A combined monster and spellbook contains over 70 new monsters and dozens of spells. The included color map of Kaball gives GM's a base for campaign level play. Die cut monster and player tokens round out this complete roleplaying package. This box provides endless hours of enjoyment.





Contents:
* Tunnels & Trolls core rules version 7.5
* Monster book with 70+ new monsters
* Spellbook with dozens of new spells
* Strange Destinies Solo Adventure
* Hot Pursuit GM Adventure
* Color world map of Kaball
* Character and Creature Tokens
* Character Record Sheet
* Dice

51290.name: The Space Gamer (Issue 51 - May 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Deux Ex Machina: The Computer as Familiar
The Big Ships in Space Opera
51290.description:
Megaships in Space Opera

Cover artist: Frank Brunner

51291.name: The Space Gamer (Issue 52 - Jun 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Deux Ex Machina: Die-Rolling Made Easy
51291.description:
Special Ogre Issue

Cover artist: David Deitrick

51292.name: GURPS Deadlands: Hexes
51292.description:
"Pick a Card, Any Card..."

User summary:

A list of spells previously published in Pinnacle's Deadlands adapted for GURPS Deadlands and new spells for both.

Also contains new huckster templates and a discussion on what it means to be a hexslinger.

51293.name: The Space Gamer (Issue 53 - Jul 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Deux Ex Machina: More Computer As Familar
Giving the Humans an Even Break

51294.name: GURPS Deadlands: Dime Novel 1 – Aces and Eights
51294.description:
Combines a fictional story and an adventure in one book.

From the back cover:

"The Dead Man's Hand!"

"Jim Wright high-tails it out of Denver, one step ahead of his would-be killers, on a journey that takes him from a fancy riverboat on the Mississippi to the dingy warehouses and opulent mansions of New Orleans, Now Wright has to figure out who wants to kill him, and why, and what a New Orleans gambler has to do with his murdered partner back in the Disputed Lands ..."

Include 16 pages of conversion rules for Deadlands to GURPS Deadlands. [which at the time had not been released yet]

51295.name: GURPS Deadlands: Dime Novel 2 - Wanted: Undead or Alive
51295.description:
"High Stakes at High Noon!"

From the back cover:

"When Caleb Harling and Mary Jo Evans rode into Bailey's End, they were expecting trouble, but they weren't expecting to find the sheriff dead at his desk. Things got worse when they discovered the bounty they were after was on a man dead for years – but just as mean as ever. Now all they have to do is figure out how to kill a man that an entire town can't stop. And this job was supposed to be easy..."

51298.name: The Space Gamer (Issue 55 - Sep 1982)
rpgissuearticle: Contest Results: Magic in Car Wars
Deux Ex Machina: Utility Programs for PBM Gamers
51298.description:
Complete Game: Necromancer

Cover artist: Dave Martin

51300.name: GURPS Modern Firepower
51300.description:
"Lock and Load!"

From back cover:

"From pistols to to rocket launchers, targeting lasers and ballistic computers, eyewear to body armor – GURPS Modern Firepower is the sourcebook for hand-held weapons, accessories, and protective equipment that have come into use in the late 20th and early 21st century. [sic] In addition, separate chapters detail ammunition and the cutting-edge weapons in development for service in the immediate future."

51301.name: Rajah Spiny Rat
51301.description:
Subtitled: A game where one's dignity may be assaulted, vandalized and cruelly mocked.

From the introduction:

Welcome to the Princely States of the Sapphire Raj, a world unlike our own. It is a world that has no knowledge of men; they may have been forgotten in a long lost age of antiquity, or perhaps they simply have not yet come. It is a world of mysteries and magic, alchemy and astrology, treachery and truth. Everything is as it appears, and yet nothing is what it seems.

This is not a world of secretive faerie tales and hidden magic; it is a flamboyant era of wondrous illusions and spectacular marvels. It is a world where the influential wield their power in defiance of the ancient gods, raising grand temples and statues in their own honour rather than obeying the gods in humility. This is a time when the poor are being trodden on and abused, the lowers castes are working themselves to death in honour of the higher castes and when those who are outspoken are being tortured, dismembered or killed in plain sight.

Yet when heroes are most hated, it is a time when The Princely States need them most.

Rajah Spiny Rat is a game of epic adventure for two or more players. Using the rules contained within this
book, players tell stories of great heroes in a strange and magical land akin to the ancient Sanskrit epics
of early Indian literature.

51302.name: GURPS Conspiracy X
51302.description:
The adaptation of Eden Studio's Conspiracy X rpg to the Gurps system.

Back Cover:
GURPS Basic Set, Third Edition Revised and GURPS Psionics are required to use this supplement in a GURPS campaign. GURPS Compendium I and GURPS High-Tech, as well as Conspiracy X's Atlantis Rising, Exodus and Nemesis are also highly recommended.

GURPS Conspiracy X combines the rich background of mystery, horror and intrigue found in Conspiracy X, the game of modern conspiracies, with the popular and powerful Generic Universal RolePlaying System.

The world of Conspiracy X is much like our own . . . if you could see beyond the lies. The same people walk the same dirty streets. The same animals rummage through the same garbage. The same mindless drivel is shown on the same television stations. Yet something is not right. There is a layer of "reality" behind that understood by ordinary people. The "real" world is a facade covering the machinations of alien invaders, conspiratorial plots and supernatural horrors. In the flood of claims, countercharges, theories and stories about "what is really going on," there are kernels of truth. A number of desperate groups will do anything to keep those truths hidden.

In Conspiracy X, players take the role of governmental officials, ranging from FBI agents to CIA spies to NSA codebreakers to Army Rangers and many more. The bond between these professionals is a super-secret organization called Aegis. Aegis was formed in the aftermath of the Roswell, NM alien sighting. It is dedicated to countering alien and supernatural menaces wherever they may arise. Any means are acceptable in the covert war that rages.

Do you have what it takes?

51303.name: Qi
51303.description:
Subtitled: The Universal Cinematic Role Playing Game

Qi focuses on better role-playing and the fastest gameplay around. With systems for managing reputation, infamy, personal honor, and character development, Qi inspires character growth and promotes role play. Skill use is setup to keep a low profile during gameplay that does not interfere with the acting. Checking for success is handled by a fast, one test system. The combat system is instinctive and simultaneous, so even large scale combats can be handled quickly. Maneuvers and mechanics are designed to control the flow of combat or stop it before it starts. Grappling or covering an opponent makes the threat of violence as effective and dramatic as charging in guns blazing. --publisher's description

51304.name: Jonril:  Gateway to the Sunken Lands
51304.description:
Jonril: Gateway to the Sunken Lands is a fully populated, predominantly human city designed to be used with the Midkemian Game System, The Tome of Midkemia. It is also compatible with most of the currently available fantasy role player games, and, with some modification, with some science-fiction role playing games and modern military role playing games.

Jonril is a truly cosmopolitan city, drawing people from many parts of Triagia (the largest continent upon Midkemia). From as far distant as the King's city of Rillanon and the heart of the Empire of Kesh come traders and adventurers seeking riches from the Sunken Lands. This accounts for the high number of foreigners residing in Jonril.

Jonril is a city with little internal constraints upon business, or tariffs upon trade, though some drugs are contraband. The small import/export duty and the few contraband goods means smuggling in Jonril is done on a small scale.

51305.name: Frontiers of Alusia
51305.description:
The Frontiers of Alusia is the first in a series of adventure maps designed for use with SPI's DragonQuest... The Frontiers of Alusia is fully compatible (with some alteration) with all currently available Fantasy Role-Playing games...

The region portrayed in Frontiers of Alusia is a thinly settled, semi-explored wilderness. The only significant population centers are the Brastor Holding and Barony of Carzala, which conduct trade with each other via the Sweetwater (dowriver to Carzala) and across the Sweet Riding (upriver to the Brastor Holding).

The remainder of the region is thinly settled by humans along the coast and the more accessible stretches of river. Small tribes of Fairy Folk, Earthdwellers, and Giants are also scattered through out the frontier, and the area abounds with all manner of game (including many fantastical creatures). The Wilderlands of Gilarni are lightly populated by small family groupings of Elves, and the Hills of Aldri are generally considered sacred to their kind, but no major Elf kingdom exists in the region covered by this map.

51306.name: The City of Carse
51306.description:
The City of Carse is a fully populated, predominantly human city designed to be compatible with any of the currently available fantasy role player games... It is especially designed for optimum enjoyment when used with the Cities rules published by Abrams and Everson (Midkemia Press).

Ages ago the inhabitants of this area were invaded by the army of a baron from a now near-mythical kingdom of the east. The Old Race, as the original inhabitants were called, resisted the newcomers.

A people of the sea, given to fair hair, green, blue, and grey eyes, the Old Race found their simple life as fishers, hunters, and traders changed by the more vigorous newcomers. Though resentful of the newcomers and their castle, they were slowly absorbed into the newly emerging city. Upheaval in the kingdom a center later caused the Baron of Carse to be nearly forgotten, and it is now a completely independent state.

Carse, despite being forgotten by the kingdom, is a busy trading center on the coast of the Endless Sea. Ever day ships from distant lands, flying strangely colored banners can be seen entering and leaving the harbor, bringing new trade goods and leaving with the products of the city. This has provided the city with a cosmopolitan feel far in excess of its size and location.

51307.name: Fantasy Masters' Screen
51307.description: A three panel screen of useful tables for use with Metagaming's The Fantasy Trip game.

51308.name: 35 or Huntex
51308.description: Late 19th century card game featuring 52 cards and what looks like a hunting theme.

51309.description: Basic spin and move game with a paper board and very basic components. Likely a promotional tie-in game.
51309.name: Safety Game

51310.name: Peek-a-Boo
51310.description:
Do we really need to describe this? It's older than civilization.

This game is frequently the first taste of fiction in a person's life - the concept of playing a role as opposed to living one.

Players take one of the roles of "I'm invisible" or "I'm the only one here" and a great time is had by all. Guaranteed to raise a smile.

51311.name: Top Pro Football Quiz Game
51311.description:
Match your wits against the pros! See the plays--learn the decisions every pro coach, player and official must make STUMP YOUR FRIENDS!

This is a trivia game that covers the rules and plays in American football. It's not your typical sports trivia game that covers players, teams, and records. So although published in 1970, most of the questions remain valid. A few are off due to rules changes to the game.

This is one of a series of triva games branded "edu-cards" and protected by patent #3154863.

51312.name: America in the War Card Game
51312.description: Early 20th Century game featuring educational facts about the American war effort in WWI.

51313.description: A promotional game published by Ovaltine - this is a basic spin and move game used to promote Ovaltine.
51313.name: Little Orphan Annie's Treasure Hunt Game

51314.description:
From the publisher's web page:

In Memory of Day is the second Asylum Pack in the Dreamlands expansion for the Call of Cthulhu Living Card Game. The lost dreamers are drawn deeper into the Dreamlands with each passing day, and the tale of Twila Katherine Price, and those she left behind, continues.

In Memory of Day contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

This is not a stand-alone deck; you must have additional Call of Cthulhu LCG cards to play.
51314.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – In Memory of Day Asylum Pack
boardgamefamily: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)

51315.name: Squeeze Your Bippy
51315.description:
A Rowan & Martin's Laugh-in game. The sketch comedy TV series ran from 1968 to 1973.

The game has some interesting components but is a basic track movement game.

51316.description: A promotional game to promote Tone's coffee. A very basic football game that uses a spinner to determine results. Instructions are only a few paragraphs long.
51316.name: Tone's Coffee Football Game

51317.name: The Forest-Lords of Dihad
51317.description:
From the text:

The province of Dihad is comprised primarily of richly forested, hilly terrain, with scattered stretches of fertile lowlands. The county is fed by over two dozen streams, tributaries of the two major rivers (the Swan and the Thunder) that flow swiftly out of the Asenborg Mountains southward to the Bay of Sighs. Most of the streams are unnavigable to any ships save canoes or rafts, except for intermittent periods during the summer months when the weather is extremely dry.

Plaize, the capital city of Dihad, is a bustling mercantile center of about 15,000 population that lies at the juncture of three primary roads....

The forests of Dihad are a changing mosaic of small camps and tent settlements, populated by the loggers and trappers who make their living from the bounteous lumber and animal resources of the region.

51319.name: Robinson Crusoe
51319.description: Late 19th Century track movement game. The board features four different starting points with the goal to reach the middle of the board where you find a picture of Robinson Crusoe.

51321.name: Summerscapes
51321.description:
This is is a promo that Frontier ran the summer of 1983. If a travel agency had this "game" displayed in a window and someone that worked there was wearing the buttons supplied in the game...they would win a free travel award from Frontier Airlines. Secret frontier employees did the checking. There were also entry forms in the game for other prizes.
Game play involves spinning a spinner to arrive at one of nine destinations. Each person starts with $100,000 of seed money. At each destination, you move around a circular track and follow instructions on the spaces until you return to the airport. Las Vegas is an exception and has cards rather than a track. Once the last player leaves the ninth unique destination, the game is over. Whoever has the most money after returning the seed is the winner.

51322.description:
"A Wiry Dan Electric Game"

A spin and move game with an electric prod that influences movement. Several themed games with this electric device were created by Harret-Gilmar.
51322.name: Howdy Doody's 3 Ring Circus

51323.name: Hungry Willie
51323.description:
Dexterity game of Been Shooting. Try to flick wood 'beans' onto a board and score points depending on what hole you land in.

Did kid's really wear that much blush in the 30's?

51324.name: Grand Census
rpgissuearticle: The Gaming Digest: Aspects of Culture
51324.description:
From the back cover:

Looking for Adventure? New cultures? Strange new socities with unusual customs? Travel can be a broadening experience, as long as you go where things are different.

Here, in one book, is all the information that players and fererees need to discover the diversity in the 11,000 worlds of the Imperium. Starting with the basic UWP for a world, Grand Census leads you step-by-step to detailed cultural characteristics, including details of the social structures, government institutions, languages, and technology.

Whether you're a Traveller player or a referee, Grand Census tells what you want to know when you arrive at a new world.

51326.description: A promotional game to advertise Kitty Clover potato chips. The game is a basic roll and move game.
51326.name: Kitty Clover Potato Chip Game

51327.name: Vikings:  Nordic Roleplaying for RuneQuest
51327.description:
From the text:

Vikings is a combination of both fact and extrapolated information... It includes facts from all known literary records and interpretations of those facts, run side by side despite the anachronisms.

The historical Viking Period roughly occurred during the years 780-1070 AD. During this era, hundreds of younger sons left home in search of land, fame, and wealth. They pillaged and settled in kingdoms from the Mediterranean to Vinland. This era could form the basis for a more or less historical game, enhance by the fantasy elements and whatever anachronisms the gamemaster desires.

Alternately, the legendary era may be used. Less is known about these years, save for the tales set forth by Saxo Grammaticus and Snorri Sturlasson. The favored period would be 500-575 AD, the time of Beowulf and Hrolf Kraki. In those days the gods still strode the world and mingled with men, monsters roamed the earth, and the Scandinavians knew next to nothing of the outside world.

51328.name: The Flaming Eye
51328.description:
From the back cover:

The Solomani have the skull and crossbones...
The Vilani have the flaming eye...
- both the dreaded symbols of villainous piracy!

In an unprecedented move, the worlds of Vland Domain, refusing the "radical policies of emperor-ad interm Lucan," have declared their independence from the thousand-year-old Imperium.

From the introduction page:

Two Campaigns for MegaTraveller

The campaigns in this book are presented using the cinematic nugget format.

Campaign 1: Search and Rescue - Concerned with the extraction of an Imperial intelligence agent from the restored Vilani empire, the main setting is Vland sector.

Campaign 2: Gamgilebo Incident - Concerns the search for two missing starships and their crews in the Vargr Extents.

51330.name: Taw Kwik
51330.description:
"The Game of Snappy Answers"

An early word game of coming up with various words that start with a certain letter that match a theme or other word.

51331.name: Monster Coliseum:  Arena Combat and Chariot Racing
51331.description:
From the text:

This book describes the coliseums and gladiators of Roman times and how they can be presented in RuneQuest terms.

The 'arena of death' has been a staple of fantasy fiction and roleplaying for as long as these genres have been in existence; now the RuneQuest gamemaster has everything he needs to expose his players to the rigors of gladiatorial combat. And layers can use this book's system and information, as well as some of the encounters in the Monster book in order to create their own solo adventures.

Components:

Coliseum Book
Monster Book
Play Aids
Chariot Track Sections (5mm scale)
Range Stick
Coliseum Floorplan (15mm scale)

51332.name: Knowledge Card Game
51332.description: Early 20th Century card game that may have been a premium/promo game.

51333.name: Ninja-To Go: A Ninja Burger Bored Game
51333.description:
Ninja-To Go is a simple little board game designed to be played between other, more fun games while you're waiting for other people to show up or get out of the bathroom or whatnot. From 2 to 8 players pick a ninja, then race to make deliveries and kill one another. The winner is the last surviving ninja, or the first to accrue enough points.

The game includes four printable sheets with cut-out game tiles, ninja figures, and dice cards - in Japanese Kanji of course. Two of the tile cards contain all the rules for setup and gameplay. Each game is designed to be played in 5-10 minutes. The only things not included are six random coins (or tokens of some sort), three six-sided dice, and your imagination. OK, that's a lie. Your imagination is included.

51334.name: Il presidente del consiglio sei... tu!
rpg: Il presidente del consiglio sei... tu!
51334.description: Appeared in June 1987, "Il presidente del consiglio sei... tu! - Un entusiasmante libro gioco per entrare da protagonista nei misteri della politica italiana" ("The Prime Minister is... You! - An exhilarating gamebook to enter as a protagnist into the misteries of Italian politics") is the first gamebook written in Italy together with "In Cerca di Fortuna". The reader is a common person trying to become Prime Minister with a collection of choice, starting with: going within the majority party or to the opposition? Witty and well written, the gamebook is now a prized collector item.

51335.name: White Dwarf (Issue 18 - Apr 1980)
rpgissuearticle: Star Trek - The Motion Picture - Miniature Rules and Scenario
51335.description:
"The Science Fiction and Fantasy Games and Miniatures Magazine"

Contents:

FEATURES

"Star Trek - The Motion Picture" - Miniature rules and scenario - (Tony Yates and Steve Jackson)

D & D mini-module
"The Halls of Tizun Thane" - (Albie Fiore)

"The Magic Brush"
Figure Painting as an Art - Part II - (Shaun Fuller)

DEPARTMENTS

Open Box - Games reviews - Traveller module (Dra'k'ne Station by Judges Guild) and 2 board games (John Olsen, John Lambshead and Bob McWilliams)

News

Treasure Chest - D & D new rules and tables - Which hand?, Weather, Heritage, NPCs and Useless Items (Paul Markovitz, Barney Sloane, Cloin Reynolds and Ian Livingstone)

Fiend Factory - A regular feature introducing new and interesting monsters for AD & D (Glen Goddard, Graham Staplehurst, Simon Tilbrook, Phil Masters, Albie Fiore)

Letters

Help! and Classifieds

51336.name: Monopoly: London Underground Edition
51336.description:
Underground Monopoly cleverly matches the classic coloured property squares to the stations and line colours of the world famous Tube map, offering you a great opportunity to navigate your way around London building your property empire as you collect Underground stations.

London Underground is the most famous subway system in the world and it is also the oldest first opening in 1863, when a service ran from Paddington to Farringdon. The first trains ran on steam, and it would be another tewnty-seven years before the world's first electric train ran on the City and South London Railway, which now forms paret of the Northern line.

Today there are more than 3 million people who use the London Underground every week day.

51337.name: Labirinti per imparare
51337.description: "Labirinti per imparare - La didattica del libro-game" ("Mazes to learn - The didactics of gamebook") is an essay about how to use gamebooks in primary schools, with 6-11 years old kids.

51338.name: The Pool
rpgissuearticle: Wriggling in the Crushing Grip of Reason #60
51338.description:
"The Pool facilitates narrativist role-playing, that is, role-playing which focuses on players as protagonists in thematically charged stories. The Pool uses an open trait system and conflict resolution instead of task resolution (that is, dice rolls determine whether a character's overall intent is achieved, rather than whether a specific attempted action is successful)."

Source: Wikipedia, "The_Pool_(game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

51341.name: Best of Dragon Magazine Vol. V
rpgissuearticle: How Many Coins in a Coffer?
What Do You Call a 25th-Level Wizard?
51341.description:
Best of Dragon Vol. 5
Selected from out-of-print issues of DRAGON magazine.
Cover art by Clyde Caldwell

51343.name: Dungeons & Dragons Adventure Game
51343.description:
From the back of the box...

There's something moving behind that door...

Perhaps it's a vicious ogre waiting to tear you limb from limb. Or a horde of zombies thirsting for blood, Or maybe a terrifying dragon ready to engulf you in a maelstrom of fire.

Problem?
Nope. Not for you. You're a hero-

a powerful wizard, a strong fighter, or a sneaky rogue. You can handle whatever comes at you in this introduction to the greatest fantasy game of all time. Everything you need to start playing is right here.

Also listed on BoardGameGeek as Dungeons & Dragons Adventure Game

51344.name: Swordsman's Guild
51344.description:
From the back of the book:

"En garde!"

You're quick with your blade and quicker with your tongue. Your enemies are numerous and waiting for a weakness. Do you spend your days watching the shadows? Or call them out on the field of honor and settle things once and for all?
You've lost your daughter to brutal kidnappers. The authorities can do nothing to help. Do you accede to the thugs' demands and pray they show mercy? Or find someone with the skills to take your little girl back?
An enraged nobleman is after your blood, demanding a duel to the death. You have no weapons and know nothing of swordplay. Will you die for some petty insult? or can the Swordsman's Guild give you the strength you need?

Twenty years ago, three men met and made a pledge to uphold the traditions of chivalric combat. From their pact rose the Swordsman's Guild, fencers, duelists and adventurers who live and die by the strength of their steel. Now, for the first time, learn what it takes to join their elite ranks, and find out just how far a good blade can take you. Draw your weapon if you have any honor: the Swordsman's Guild demands satisfaction.

Swordsman's Guild includes:

- Extensive background on each of the numerous schools approved by the Guild.
- A complete history of the Guild, from its founding up to the present day.
- Details on the Guild's most important NPCs, from the stalwart Miles Donovan to the deadly Linnae Knute.
- Rules and guidelines for conducting duels, including Reputation effects and ways to spin such conflicts into larger adventures.
- A host of tips for playing Swordsman Heroes.
- Nine completely new Swordsman Schools, approved by the Guild and ready to play!

51346.name: Kara-Tur: The Eastern Realms
51346.description:
From the back of the box...

THE MYSTERIOUS ORIENT

This box contains everything AD&D game players and DMs need to establish an exciting Oriental Adventures campaign! Kara-Tur, world of Eastern mystery, is on the far side of the planet from the FORGOTTEN REALMS Campaign Setting, but the two cultures interact only if you want them to! This is the "official" campaign setting for the Oriental Adventures rulebook. Kara-Tur has everything you need: Two 96-page books describe the places, culture, politics, monsters, magic, people, religions, and more, plus advice on running a long-term Oriental Adventures campaign, bringing characters from other worlds into Kara-Tur, and dimensional travel from Kara-Tur to other worlds. And there are four full color, two-sided maps of this land of mighty warriors and powerful enchantments.

51347.name: Guns!, guns!, guns! (3rd edition)
51347.description:
From the back of the book:
Guns!, guns!, guns! (3G³ for short) lets you design custom weapons for virtually any roleplaying game. Design realistic weapons in a universal format, and convert the stats to the system you like best, or even between different systems. In addition to the overall conversion guidelines, there are now detailed conversion notes for Corps, TimeLords, MegaTraveller, Cyberpunk, TORG, GURPS, Twilight: 2000, and the HERO system.
Pick your weapon! You can choose from conventional weapons, rockets, lasers, particle beams, railguns and melee weapons. Detailed directions and step-by-step design sheets help guide you through each aspect of custom weapon design.
Design weapons for any Tech Level where they are possible, not just where they historically appeared. Want to give the Romans machine pistols? Or design lasers for WWII? If it could have been done, or if it might be done, you can do it, in 3G³.

51348.name: Netheril: Empire of Magic
